the lean sinewy hand, showed that the prince still possessed the tena- cious endurance and vigor of hardy old age. After a few more turns of the lathe he removed his foot from the pedal, wiped his chisel, dropped it into a leather pouch attached to the lathe, and, approaching the table, summoned his daughter. He never gave his children a bless- ing, so he simply held out his bristly cheek (as yet unshaven) and, regarding her tenderly and attentively, said severely: 
"Quite well? All right then,
